recipes.name: Healthy Lemon Bars
recipes.ingredients: Produce 1 tsp Lemon, zest Refrigerated 3 Eggs + 1 egg yolk Condiments 3/4 cup Lemon juice, fresh squeezed 3/4 cup Maple syrup Baking & Spices 1 1/2 cups Almond flour 5/16 cup Coconut flour 1/4 tsp Salt 1 tsp Vanilla Oils & Vinegars 1/3 cup Coconut oil
recipes.directions: 1.    Preheat oven 350F.  2.     Make the crust: In a medium bowl, whisk together the almond flour, coconut flour, tapioca flour, and sea salt. Add the maple syrup, ghee, and vanilla to the bowl, and fold everything together until a dough forms. Press the crust into the bottom of the prepared pan and bake for 12 minutes.  3.     Make the Filling: While the crust bakes, make the filling. Add the eggs, lemon juice, maple syrup, and lemon zest to a large bowl and whisk well by hand. Don‚Äôt use a mixer for this, as whisking by hand is the best way to fully incorporate the eggs. Whisk quickly until you don‚Äôt see any egg white remaining. Add the tapioca flour and whisk until there are no clumps. Once the crust has finished baking, remove it from the oven. Immediately add the filling. Do not allow the crust to cool.  4.     Bake the Bars: Lower the temperature to 325 degrees Fahrenheit and return the bars to the oven to bake for 20-22 minutes, or until the filling is set. A little jiggle in the center is just right!  5.    Chill: Allow the bars to cool completely, then transfer the pan to the refrigerator for 3-4 hours to let the bars set. Before serving, cut into twelve squares and sprinkle the bars with powdered sugar. Enjoy!

recipes.name: Homemade Laurabars
recipes.ingredients: 1 cup nuts any combination, 1 ¬Ω cups dates or a combination of dates and another variety of dried fruit, 1 dash of salt
recipes.directions: 1. Place dates into a small heat-safe bowl. Pour hot water over the dates and allow to soak for 10-15 minutes to soften the dates. 2. Once the dates have soaked, drain the liquid off the dates, reserving the liquid to use if needed. 3. Fit a food processor with an s-blade. Place nuts in the food processor and pulse until the nuts break down into small pieces.  4. Add in the dates and dash of salt, and pulse the mixture together until the dates have broken down and a thick paste forms, scraping the sides down if needed. Add in 1 to 2 tablespoons of the soaking liquid if needed to help bring the mixture together.  5. To shape larabars press mixture into a 7√ó11 pan lined with parchment paper and refrigerate for 30 minutes before slicing int0 6 bars. 6. Alternatively, you can shape the mixture into 1-2 inch balls for a bite-size treat.

recipes.name: Healthy Granola Bars
recipes.ingredients: 4 cups old-fashioned rolled oats (use certified gluten-free oats for gluten-free granola), 1 ¬Ω cup raw nuts and/or seeds (I used 1 cup pecans and ¬Ω cup pepitas), 1 teaspoon fine-grain sea salt (if you‚Äôre using standard table salt, scale back to ¬æ teaspoon), ¬Ω teaspoon ground cinnamon, ¬Ω cup melted coconut oil or olive oil, ¬Ω cup maple syrup or honey, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, ‚Öî cup dried fruit, chopped if large (I used dried cranberries). Totally optional additional mix-ins: ¬Ω cup chocolate chips or coconut flakes
recipes.directions: Preheat oven 350F. 1. Combine oats, nuts, seeds, salt and cinnamon.  2. Pour in oil, maple syrup and vanilla.  3. Bake 21-24 minutes...until lightly golden  4. Let cool completely. It will store for up to 2 weeks.

recipes.name: GF Pizza Quesadilla
recipes.ingredients: 2 Corn Tortillas or other gluten-free tortilla of choice, 1/4 cup shredded mozzarella,  4 slices pepperoni see notes for vegan modification sprinkle Italian seasoning, 1/2 cup tomato sauce of choice, gluten-free cooking spray
recipes.directions: 1. Heat pan on medium heat.  2. Once heated, spray with cooking spray and lay a tortilla on top of the pan.  3. Sprinkle cheese, seasoning, and pepperonis on top of the tortilla. Place a lid on top of the pan so the cheese melts. It should take 1-2 minutes for the cheese to melt.  4. Once the cheese is melted, remove the lid and place second tortilla on top. Flip quesadilla and toast the other side for 1-2 minutes so both sides can be toasted.  5. Slice the quesadilla into triangles and dip in favorite pizza or pasta sauce

recipes.name: GF Quesadilla Pizza Dips
recipes.ingredients: 2 Corn Tortillas or other gluten-free tortilla of choice, 1/4 cup shredded mozzarella see notes for dairy-free/vegan modification, 4 slices pepperoni see notes for vegan modification, sprinkle Italian seasoning, 1/2 cup tomato sauce of choice, gluten-free cooking spray
recipes.directions: 1. Heat pan on medium heat. 2. Once heated, spray with cooking spray and lay a tortilla on top of the pan. 3. Sprinkle cheese, seasoning, and pepperonis on top of the tortilla. 4. Place a lid on top of the pan so the cheese melts. It should take 1-2 minutes for the cheese to melt. 5. Once the cheese is melted, remove the lid and place second tortilla on top. Flip quesadilla and toast the other side for 1-2 minutes so both sides can be toasted. 6. Slice the quesadilla into triangles and dip in favorite pizza or pasta sauce

recipes.name: Garlic Chickpea Soup
recipes.ingredients: Produce: 2 cans (15 oz each) chickpeas 1 (6oz-180 grams) large potato, large 1/4 tsp Chili flakes 3 Garlic cloves, large 1 tsp Rosemary, dried 1/2 tsp Thyme, dried Canned Goods: 2 cups Vegetable broth, low-sodium Baking & Spices: 1 tsp Paprika 1 Salt & black pepper Oils & Vinegars: 1 tbsp Olive oil
recipes.directions: 1. Blend half of the chickpeas. 2. Saut√© garlic in olive oil. 3. Add chickpeas, herbs, spices, and potato. 4. Stir in broth. 5. Cook for 27 minutes.

recipes.name: GF Mozzarella Sticks
recipes.ingredients: Produce 1 tsp Basil, dried 1/2 tsp Garlic powder 1 tsp Oregano, dried 1 tbsp Parsley, dried 1 Parsley Refrigerated 2 Eggs Condiments 1 Marinara sauce Baking & Spices 1/4 cup All-purpose gluten-free flour 1 Salt and pepper Oils & Vinegars 1 Oil Bread & Baked Goods 2 cups Panko breadcrumbs, gluten-free Dairy 1 tbsp Milk 12 Mozzarella string cheese sticks
recipes.directions: 1. Line baking sheet with parchment paper. 2, Place flour in one bowl. 3. In second bowl, whisk eggs and milk until combined. 4. In third bowl, thoroughly combine bread crumbs, salt, pepper, parsley, garlic powder, basil, and oregano. 5. Take one mozzarella stick. Dip in flour and roll until lightly coated. Don't forget to coat ends of cheese stick in all steps. 6. Immediately dip flour-coated mozzarella stick into egg wash. Roll until coated. 7. From egg wash, immediately dip mozzarella stick into breadcrumb mixture. Roll until coated. Gently press the panko onto mozzarella stick. 8. Fry approximately 2 minutes, until breading is golden brown and crispy. Transfer cooked mozzarella sticks to paper towel to drain oil. Repeat process for remaining mozzarella sticks.

recipes.name: Peanut Butter Oatmeal Balls
recipes.ingredients: Breakfast Foods: 1 cup GF Rolled oats Condiments: 1/4 cup Maple syrup or honey, 1/2 cup Peanut butter Baking & Spices: 1/4 cup Dark chocolate chips Nuts & Seeds: 2 tbsp Flax seeds and/or chia seeds, ground Other: 2- 3 tbsp nut milk or other liquid of choice (optional)
recipes.directions: Since these are no-bake balls all you will need to do is mix the ingredients, roll them into balls and let them chill for a couple of hours in the fridge. It‚Äôs that simple!

recipes.name: No-Bake Chocolate PB Crunch Bars
recipes.ingredients: 3c Crispy Rice Cereal, 1/4c Peanut Butter, 1/4c Chocolate Chips, 2T Maple Syrup, 2T Coconut oil
recipes.directions: 1.  Line an 8 x 8-inch baking dish or deep baking tray of choice with parchment paper and set aside.  2. Add crispy rice cereal into a large mixing bowl and set aside. In a microwave safe bowl or stovetop, combine all your other ingredients and heat until melted. Remove from microwave/off stove and whisk until completely incorporated. 3. Pour the chocolate/peanut butter mixture over the crispy rice cereal and mix until combined. Pour into the lined baking dish and refrigerate until firm (at least an hour). 4. Remove and cut into bars.

comments.content: To avoid baked goods becoming soggy, transfer to a wire rack as soon as possible after baking to ensure that they cool properly.
Substituting 1/4 cup ground flaxseed in 1/4 cup water for 1/4 cup flour will increase nutrition in any recipe.
Coconut, soy, rice and nut milks can be substituted for regular milk. ‚ù§ü•õ
Gluten-free baking at high altitude requires less liquid and either a higher oven temperature or a longer baking time. üèî
Maple syrup, brown rice syrup and agave can also be used instead of honey. üçØ
I follow a dairy-free and gluten-free diet, which can be challenging in some places. üòµü•ó

New bakers should try adding extra vanilla and/or spices to recipes. Gluten-free flours often have unique tastes, and adding additional flavoring to recipes will help cover up these unfamiliar flavors. üßÇ üçã
